titleInfo.title: Select pages from "Pictorial history of the American Negro," circa 1933

location.physicalLocation: Special Collections Division of the Nashville Public Library, 615 Church Street, Nashville, Tennessee, 3721

mods.abstract: Select pages from the book "Pictorial history of the American Negro by Thomas O. Fuller. The book was published in 1933 and includes photographs of important institutions and individuals in the African American community. Thomas O. Fuller was a prominent African American church and civic leader, and author in early twentieth-century Memphis. He was also a prolific writer of books and publications aimed at increasing African American pride, including his own autobiography. Fuller hoped by providing African American history missing from traditional American history narratives, these publications would empower Black youth to continue the established progress of their forefathers.

titleInfo.title: Generations - African American Women's Early Activism in Tennessee
